meanings.definition: Of or relating to ancient Greek or Latin literature, art, or culture.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a collection of classical sculptures from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent2: She studied classical literature in her history class.
meanings.sent3: The students put on a classical play for the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress had a classical style that reminded me of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The classical music concert transported the audience back in time.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the highly developed style of art, literature, music, or architecture of ancient Greece and Rome.
meanings.sent1: The classical columns on the building added a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent2: The library had a vast collection of classical paintings from the Renaissance period.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a classical dish using traditional Roman recipes.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a classical elegance that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The classical architecture of the cathedral was awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the traditional or long-established style or form.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant served classical dishes that had been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work was a blend of modern and classical elements.
meanings.sent3: The classical design of the furniture gave the room a timeless feel.
meanings.sent4: His speech followed a classical structure that was easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: The garden was decorated in a classical style with statues and fountains.
